html:
The Cure released their first new record in 16 years Songs For A Lost World in 2024, and now they're back with a massive remix compilation! The Cure has just announced Mixes Of A Lost World, conceived and compiled by the band's frontman Robert Smith. The set features brand-new remixes from Four Tet, Paul Oakenfold, Orbital and many more, with the deluxe edition including additional remixes and reworks by Chino Moreno (Deftones), Mogwai and 65daysofstatic, among others.

Mixes Of A Lost World runs as follows (if you get the massive 3CD or 3LP set), and is out on June 13. Pre-orders for Mixes of a Lost World are available here.

  1. "I Can Never Say Goodbye" – Paul Oakenfold
  2. "Endsong" – Orbital
  3. "Drone:Nodrone" – Daniel Avery
  4. "All I Ever Am" – meera
  5. "A Fragile Thing" – Âme
  6. "And Nothing Is Forever" – Danny Briottet & Rico Conning
  7. "Warsong" – Daybreakers
  8. "Alone" – Four Tet
  9. "I Can Never Say Goodbye" – Mental Overdrive
  10. "And Nothing Is Forever" – Cosmodelica Electric Eden
  11. "A Fragile Thing" – Sally C
  12. "Endsong" – Gregor Tresher
  13. "Warsong" – Omid 16B
  14. "Drone:Nodrone" – Anja Schneider
  15. "Alone" – Shanti Celeste "February Blues"
  16. "All I Ever Am" – Mura Masa
  17. "I Can Never Say Goodbye" – Craven Faults
  18. "Drone:Nodrone" – JoyCut "Anti-Gravitational"
  19. "And Nothing Is Forever" – Trentemøller
  20. "Warsong" – Chino Moreno
  21. "Alone" – Ex-Easter Island Head
  22. "All I Ever Am" – 65daysofstatic
  23. "A Fragile Thing" – The Twilight Sad
  24. "Endsong" – Mogwai

"Just after Christmas I was sent a couple of unsolicited remixes of Songs of a Lost World tracks and I really loved them," said The Cure's Robert Smith of the remix album. "The Cure has a colourful history with all kinds of dance music, and I was curious as to how the whole album would sound entirely reinterpreted by others. This curiosity resulted in a fabulous trip through all 8 songs by 24 wonderful artists and remixers and is way beyond anything I could have hoped for. Giving our recording royalties from the project to War Child helps make Mixes of a Lost World an even more special release."
